Okay I just have to take the time to comment on how Virgil at the end when heâ€™s excited is so accurate to how anxiety can portray itself in positive scenarios. I have a lot of anxiety, and this past year have been exposed to other ways that anxiety shows itself in day-to-day life, not just in extremely unhappy or negatively stressful situations. There are many relatively positive situations where anxiety is still at the forefront, often coming out as lots of extra movement or shaky hands or pacing or smiling and laughing excessively, which isnâ€™t necessarily a negative experience but is still stemming from my anxiety. I just really love how Virgil, with the purple eyeshadow (which is an amazing touch that gives us some extra worldbuilding(?) about how emotions can affect how some sides express themselves) is showcasing those other ways that anxiety affects us. Lots of love for Thomas and the team for being so thoughtful in all of their work on Sanders Sides, and Iâ€™m sooo excited for the future (:

I relate so much to this situation only not with anxiety but my autism instead. Every time I've had feelings for someone, I've always gone the long way round when trying to find out if they like women and/or are single as I get too nervous or worried to ask in case its seen as rude. This can go from small idea like looking at pins on bags like you did, to massive stupid ideas and plans which makes me look even more weirder then if I had just asked.   A perfect example of the latter was with a girl in college, who I only found out liked women and was single when I invited her over to mine and we watched 3 videos about childhood crushes so ( I kid you not) I could find out if she had any female crushes and if she liked them more then the male ones. I like the ending part. When Roman tells Virgil that he showed bravery by pushing Thomas, I like to headcanon that it wasn't actually bravery he exhibited. Instead, it was Virgil's fear of missing the opportunity to be happy that he subconsciously exaggerated by seeing both Thomas and Roman unhappy. This would also fit with Virgil's character bc he's the embodiment of Thomas's anxiety and bravery is part of Roman's character which is why he mistook Virgil's fear for bravery.  Tl;dr Virgil pushes for love in fear of being alone, but Roman mistakes that for bravery bc that's what he's used to.

@Thomas Sanders       You don't know me. I'm just another random person on the internet and I don't know if you read these but if you do I'd like to say thank you. Whenever I'm having a bad day and I just need a reason to smile, I know I can watch your videos and I'll immediately feel better. There's been a lot happening lately, both in the world and in my personal life (what with dysphoria, anxiety over coming out, depression, family issues, etc.), and it's all just been really overwhelming. There have been days where it's really hard to keep going. At one point I actually considered not continuing. Then I found your videos and all that around June last year and things started to get a little bit better. I had something to look forward to again.        It's not just about the actual content. I mean sure, that's a big part of it, but more than anything it's the way that you make me feel seen. Like I matter. And it's not just me, there are lots of people who appreciate that all-around kindness more than you might realize. It might not fix everything right away, but it is a really, REALLY big help.       Anyway, I realize that I'm rambling and if you ARE in fact reading this you're probably thinking "Man, this is a long comment," so I'll wrap it up now. I just wanted to say, from the bottom of my heart:  Thank you Thomas Sanders. You saved my life.

This honestly hit really close to home as a bisexual. I used to be a huge introvert (by my own volition because I was trying to be "emo" at that point) and back then I had plenty of people who fit my criteria to be "my type". Although, I could never talk with them because I kept overthinking everything I was going to say, just like in this episode. For example, I ended up with the perfect chance to talk with someone I liked and I ended up just blatantly answering the questions they had about their tech issues for a recording software we used in class. It was a rough start, but now I finally got myself figured out for once. This episode seriously made me reminiscent of back then, so I was laughing the whole way through. As always, amazing work, and I'm excited to see more really creative stuff like this in the future!

At the end Virgil's eyeshadow goes from sparkling purple when he's happy to his usual dark eyeshadow when he's upset, and since we've seen that sides can change over time (i.e. Remus and Roman splitting into two), the same thing is going to happen to Virgil. Here's my theory:   We know Virgil started out as a dark side, (he was probably Paranoia because in the episode 'Intrusive Thoughts', Logan almost calls Virgil paranoid before correcting himself, this causes Virgil and Patton to become quiet) I think something happened to Thomas that made Virgil become Anxiety, (maybe Patton took Virgil in which caused Virgil to become more tame because he had someone positive in his life to teach him right from wrong. This would explain why he and Patton have a father-son relationship) But when he stopped being Paranoia, this caused him to enter the emo phase we see him in now.   Then the gang accepted him in the episode 'Is Anxiety Good?' and showed they weren't scared of him anymore in the Halloween episode, (and in the Halloween episode, Virgil says although he's gone through phases, those phases are a part of him, so him being an emo could be another phase he's going through, further proving that him being Anxiety is a phase he'll grow out of) and Virgil has been shown to be more mature and responsible than he was in the first couple of episodes, (Like when he makes Thomas rehearse before a performance or in this episode when he forced Thomas to talk to Nico)   So with all of that being said, I predict in the next episode Virgil will debate weather or not he's ready for this new relationship with Nico, battling with his past with being Paranoia and his present with being Anxiety. And in the end, he'll realize that he's ready and his journey from being a dark side to being a good side will become full-circle and he'll transform into...Excitement!   *Bonus theory: most sides have animals that represent them, Patton is a frog, Janus is a snake, and Remus is an octopus. Virgil's animal is a spider as seen from his room and because arachnophobia is a common fear, (his animal being a spider is probably left over from his time as Paranoia, so back then Virgil probably used spiders to scare Thomas) so I predict when he becomes Excitement, his animal will go from a spider to a butterfly! (Because y'know, "butterflies in your stomach". And because butterflies go through phases: larvae, caterpillar, and butterfly, mirroring Virgil going from Paranoia to Anxiety to Excitement! Which would be cute (â—â€¢á´—â€¢â—))*   Also, Remus will probably be in the next episode and will force Virgil to think about not being ready and his time as Paranoia, *(Because in Remus' first episode, he wanted to make Virgil become Paranoia again by causing Thomas to have intrusive thoughts. We see this when Remus becomes happy when Logan points out that Virgil was being the problem and Remus threatening Logan when he tried calming Virgil down by using logic.) This is Remus' master plan, undoing the gang's progress by making everyone become a dark side and as a result, making Thomas a deranged lunitic. The reason? Because he was abandoned by Thomas and wants revenge.* But coming back to Virgil, this causes Virgil to battle with his past or perhaps turn into a spider like how Patton turned into a frog in the Redux episode. Either way, the next episode is going to be _very_ interesting...

Ok, I have a homophobic family, and because of that I was very self hating and had a bunch of build up internalized homophobia. After years of struggling, I finally came to terms with my sexuality about a year ago, and have finally accepted myself for who I am. So, since I'll probably never be able to come out to any of my family, and even if I did get the courage too, they wouldn't accept me and tell me to go through conversion, I decide to come out here. Sooooo Hia. My name is Mo. I'm bi and have girlfriend that I love very much. We are both very closeted, and I'm just happy that I can at least come out like this, even though I don't know any of you. I would like to have a virgil sometimes, because the number of times such a situation like the one depicted in this episode has happened to me is kind of large. My anxiety isn't a balanced person like good ol' virg, it's more like a mass of negative emotions that stands between me and the person I want to approach, making me unable to go talk to them. This shapeless mass is a mix of all the bad from all the sides, deceptive, mean-spirited, egocentric, overly pragmatic to a point of unrealism, cynical, ect. The main differences between me and Thomas are few but important, and they are: I have one side (the dark mass from before); I am straight; I am below 20; I am not from the states. Those differences make it so that I have less experience in life, I am less balanced, I am part of the "sexual norm" and I live in a different society. Just... just all the times this mass got me thinking "suicide is a viable option" makes me want an honest and protective figure like virgil, but all I have is the mass. If you read this, I thank you and I'm sorry for being so dramatic, depression (undiagnosed too) isn't easy to live with. If you ever find this comment Thomas, thanks for your videos, they keep me alive. Sincerely, an unwell internet user.

I was having a bad day at the end of a bad week. I was alone in the house I live in, and because of increased lockdown in my area of the UK I had to ring my Dad and explain that I couldn't head down to the south coast to visit him. Aaaaand... he didn't take it well. I've never been the patron saint of sonhood in terms of staying in contact before Corona, and now I've been trying to make an effort I can't, and he understandably took it as me not WANTING to see him, which couldn't be further from the truth.  And then I saw this video, about being brave and facing things, even if you screw up and made mistakes in the past. And it made me smile, gave me hope and the courage to call my Dad and have a real conversation about things.  To summarise that convo; we're now on the same page, and I feel SO much better, as does he.  You did that Thomas, you helped me feel brave. Thank you.

Catch me out here screaming not just about Pintroverts/Karrot Kings/Flanders/every other iteration of Thomas/Nico, but also this episode reflecting the process of Janus being accepted as a valid side??? I may or may not be crying in the club rn  Like-- it reminds me of SvS pt.1 when Janus is talking about "taking off the blindfold" in order for Thomas to get the stuff he wants out of life. That speech has always been a double-edged sword for him as a character. On a superficial level, it can seem like he's advocating for obfuscating the truth in the short-term (the "Aunt Patty in the hospital excuse") to make it to the callback, ("Do you want the part or not?") but in my opinion, Janus has always cared less about what the truth was, and more about Thomas being honest with himself about what that truth is (i.e., who he is and what he wants out of his life). Virgil may not call Janus by his true name at 15:40, he still cares about Janus' well-being more than he has in past episodes ("Your face ruined my day," SvS part 1) asking if putting this pressure on Janus is "fair to him." (Note: I think Thomas and Joan are taking advantage of a double meaning in this line, using "him" to be Janus and Nico, because "him" in this case could be Nico, but grammatically, I'm pretty sure that's an antecedent for Janus so hhhhh -- )   After SvSR, with three of the key sides not present (Virgil, Logan, and Remus), and Roman leaving after exchanging harsh words with Janus, it was clear that accepting him as a side wasn't going to be as simple as accepting Virgil. Even including Virgil took another few episodes after the explicit choice made in AA part two, including another one dedicated to the topic, "Fitting In." Accounting for Janus' transitional period even in an aside (in an Asides video, no less :P) was just extremely satisfying, even though we might get another video in the main series to further cement Thomas' acceptance of Janus. OH GOD THIS HIT SO CLOSE TO HOME I am such a gay disaster it took me literally 2 and a half years of hardcore crushing and adoring them from a far before telling my partner I like them. And coming up to them about it was like the button peek trashcan scene.
Hi Thomas, congratulations on the new video! I'd absolutely adore seeing this live action remade whenever that becomes a safe possibility.   I love the artstyle - it looks so sweet! The comedic timing is on point and you made me laugh out loud - hysterically - a ton! All of it was so cute, so sweet, so lovely!! I am so incredibly impressed. Also, the writing and storyboarding and character interactions are *chef's kiss*!  The subject of the video is something that has been bothering me more increasingly the past few months. I want a relationship with another person that is intimate and romantic. But when I see a cute person in public I don't even consider going up to them. Also, meeting new people give me a lot of anxiety. Especially the last part of the video hit me very hard, when you started talking about possibilities and regretting not going up to the guy afterwards. It confronted me with the things I refused to let myself think, because thinking about those possible futures makes me feel very very anxious.  And when Virgil  made Thomas go up to the guy - when those doubts and fears turned into courage - and talk to him in his own honest and awkward way, and it /went well/, it nailed the point home to me about what I was doing and I could be missing out on.   I think I've been so focused on the bad things that could happen, that any possible good thing would not be worth it.  "It's true. I do tend to waste a lot of opportunities in my life." You cut me while I was down, you smashed a brick of realization in my face and rubbed salt into the wounds.  It's good though. I think I needed to have that realization in order to process and move forward. I think I'll be able to look back at this and be glad it happened.  Now though? I'm crying and anxious about lost opportunities, old hurts and new hurts, the future and the past. I'll probably be struggling a lot with this for a while longer.  This realization sucks and it hurts, but because of your video I have learned more about myself than I did yesterday, and that is a good thing. Realization is the first step towards improvement and becoming a better person. Thank you for everything.  I've been scared to post this, but I'm just going to do it.

I like how at the end, Virgilâ€™s eyeshadow switched between sparkly purple (when he was excited) and black (after hearing Thomasâ€™s subtweet, and after Thomas asked if he was ready)
I commented this on "Putting Others First" and it is the only idea about the show and its characters that I've really ever felt passionate about. I can't afford a Patreon right now, so I offer this idea to anyone that also loves it and can get it to the creators for me.   This is an exact copy and paste from my reply to Bright Eyes on their color theory of a possible orange side.  "Love your last theory about humanity. Honestly the one thing I noticed is that there is two blues (morality and logic). I'm a psychology student, and one of the interesting things that I loved about this video is the language. When we are children we develop a faulty logic, where be believe we have no choice when it comes to our well being and that somehow we can change the emotions of others. We learn that our actions have consequences and begin to develop foresight but not fully master it. This leads to a lot of language use like "I have to..." in regards to relationships, when actually our interactions are a choice. A child might think they have to get good grades to make their mother happy and that is their motivation, but an adult realizes that they choose to get good grades because it leaves themselves feeling more fulfilled and in the process makes their mother happy. Adults learn that they cannot control someone else's emotions through actions. Learning that all you can to is control how you respond is a hard life lesson.   What I would love to see is Patton evolving to Orange his color compliment as he learns that emotional intelligence isn't reliant on foresight and built in 'sharp' boxes of good or bad (logic, blue). Watching Patton tap into the passionate intensities of emotions (red, raw emotions) and finding confidence to be okay with the unknown reason for his decisions (yellow, intuition and empathy) would be so beautiful to me."   Thanks a million for reading. I love Sander's Sides and when I'm better off financially you better bet I will be a Gross Profit Member!

It's because they DIED SPIRITUALLY that awful day, and all mankind has been born spiritually dead since (Romans 5:12).Â Please understand that spiritual death and the second death areÂ notÂ the same.Â Every person who is not born again is ALREADY spiritually dead.Â The second death is Gehenna, i.e., the Lake of Fire (Revelation 20:11-15).Â All those who die in their sins, without being born again( that is believing that Jesus Christ got crucified and shed his blood for their sins, buried and rose again in the third day and alive now in heaven), will be arraigned, prosecuted, and sentenced atÂ The Great White Throne of JudgmentÂ and then cast into the Lake of Fire forever.Â   Believing at Christ does not involve worship of other gods(church leader&ancestors), object(hand bands,car stickers,trees e.t.c) Muhammad,buddha e.t.c. 3 AM BRAIN TALKING I HAVE A THEORY!  Virgil wasn't always anxiety. I mean we kinda knew that but I think I figured out who Virgil was: EXCITEMENT. That's why Patton is always defending him, because joy and excitement go hand in hand. If you notice Virgil's room, its still things Thomas ENJOYS. Being scared and being excited in a young child are typically a similar emotion until the age of 4 or 5, and as we saw with Roman and Remus, Thomas has developed several sides over the course of his life. What's to stop a side from doing the same? The purple eye shadow is the key. That's old excitement coming out. And I'll be, excited (get it) if this is the big reveal later. Love your work Thomas, Joan, and the rest of these wonderful artists. Peace out!

I noticed how Virgil's eyeshadow changed with the fluctuation of his mood/happiness/excitement.  When he got stressed/upset (or maybe the fear/anxiety was starting to peak again) his eyeshadow was black and was bigger.  When he was excited/happy (perhaps when the anxiety eased or lessened momentarily) his eyeshadow was more colorful, more purple, and was much smaller.

Self-stimulatory behaviours (or stimming) are usually connected to autism however it is a common thing for anyone to do to help ease anxiety. Itâ€™s just something fun I noticed that I can relate to (being autistic myself I stim a lot). Itâ€™s nice not only to see it, but to also normalise it for people who are nurotypical. I think thatâ€™s cool.

My experience in flirting. Tips and tricks for modern day flirting. Option 1: Just go up to them. Compliment them and ask if they're single. Hey um this is gonna get buried in the uhh 9k comments but this I uh This was important to me. In ways that will be oversharing if I delved into them. But the fear is so relatable that I assumed from the get-go that this will have the obvious bad end because it typically does. Not every Romeo carries a pride pin. Not every Prince Charming feels approachable. They just get piled along with the rest of the self-hating mess-ups you don't get to forget about late at night when you feel like your bed's too big; when you feel hollowed out and want someone there to spoon you. Someone to look at as they rest beside you. Someone that makes you feel wanted and loved in ways that your family just... couldn't do.  Quarantine makes meeting people Non-existent. So you don't get chances to try to be less alone. Less cocooned by... deafening nothing. Nothing and a lot of gay art on your Twitter tl.  Idk, I guess seeing a good script/outcome of a nightmarishly self-defeating situation meant a lot to me right now. ..thank you, from a tiny country that has a ways to go before I could stop someone on the street and compliment them. That will take time. But this might make the waiting period more bearable.  So yeah, thanks begaydoarson

Ok theory time: Some Spoilers! And angst            So we can infer that when Virgil is feeling less anxious and is more happy his eyeshadow starts becoming purple, but when that anxiety returns his eyeshadow becomes black again. However, this in turn implies that Virgil hasn't felt this amount of happiness throughout the entire series, as this is our first time seeing this happen. Even when Virgil has acted happy, it wasn't on this level. Roman also says to Virgil "if I am, I'll add it to the list!" In response to Virgil telling him he's making a mistake, which shows that Roman is almost keeping check of that he has made mistakes and a lot of them. If Roman meant this in a literal sense or not, because Roman would make a list of mistakes, like a actual lost that is a list of his mistakes, I'm not sure. I also believe that the way they write lines is supposed to symbolize something. Virgil and Roman constantly mention that Thomas shouldn't be living on lies and that deceit isn't always the awnser. I believe this is attempting to throw some light on why Virgil left the dark sides. The episode also says that Thomas shouldn't build the relationship on lies, or else what would happen in the future. They also mention that Thomas might not deserve him if he just lies to him. I believe that the situation might be a showing of what happened in the dark sides. Deceit was the awnser to them, in a figuritive and literal sense. Janus was a awnser to Virgil and Remus. Deceit was the awnser to Janus and in turn the others. But as they say, what will become of a  relationship that's built on lies(any relationship of that matter, platonic or romantic)? And we see Thomas questioning if he deserves this person. The obvious awnser might be Janus, but not now. I believe that Virgil might fit this stance. They even say Deceit isn't the awnser to everything (though I might be throwing at that point). But Virgil fits this. We see Virgil question his morals and says that they were better off without him when he ducked out. This is almost a direct mirror of what Thomas was thinking. Virgil even tried to leave the Light Sides by ducking out. I believe that Virgil tried leaving the Dark Sides because as he thought with the Light Sides, they were better off without him. Except that Virgil succeeded in leaving. I theorize that the episode is supposed to help shed light on the situation and on Virgil. They fail and leave the guy alone at first. But this time Virgil takes a leap and connects Thomas and the guy. And I believe and hope that it's supposed to be foreshadowing that Virgil wants to reconnect with the Dark Sides, he just needs to take a leap and speak from his heart.

isn't/wasn't human (and he was in his own state of mind forgetting whats real and whats not), or, the thing that Virgil was thinking about was something about a demon/someone that he knew, was seen as you're gonna need to keep up those lies the whole time you're in a/the relationship, which is not a good thing, because the second you accidentally (or purposely) show what you're actually like, I think that with Detective Pikachu, the Sonic movie & now this Asides episode, it's fair to say that fanart is not such a waste of time as people say. It's giving creators a look good at their work in a different medium (whether it's giving the live-action treatment with Pokemon & Sonic or making the sides a cartoon) and it's giving artists more work that it can become a viable career for them just by drawing something they're passionate for. I not only commend Thomas & Crew for picking these icons in the fandom to work on this episode, but also to Kelly, Alex & Brei for doing an incredible job bringing these characters to life in animatic form. Starting as fans to becoming part of the team, incredible job to everyone for this amazing Asides episode!

I'm not through yet but "I hate to rain on your black parade, Gerard Gay" is beautiful.
Honestly, this is kind of how my boyfriend and I met. We were at a school event, separately, and both of our friends happened to ditch us.  He was standing near one of the tables in our college's Center Green, and I noticed that he has the same Pride lanyard that I had. I did almost the exact same thing as Thomas, kinda wandering my way over with anxiety fighting me, then I saw him starting to leave and my impulse just kind of took control and I walked over to him and said, not so eloquently, "HI! So, I, uh, noticed, erm, that you, uh, have the same lanyard as I do..." He looked down at his pocket and the Pride lanyard hanging out and saw the same from my pocket. He smiled and said, "Hey, yeah! Are you LGBT?"  My brain went "OH MY GOD" and answered "YeAh." He laughed slightly and smiled again before saying, "Hey, it looks like we're both headed back to the dorms, want to walk together?" So we started walking back and he glanced to the side. "I'm John, by the way." I smiled back and said, "I'm Dean. Nice to meet you." In the span of the five-minute walk from the Greens to our dorms, we found that we had so much in common, and in the main area of our dorms before we went our separate ways he asks me, "Hey, so, do you want to maybe get lunch together tomorrow?" I immediately said yes, and he held out his hand for a handshake. "Cool, I'll see you then. Goodnight, and... I'm really glad to have met you." When I got back to my room I had pretty much the same reaction as Thomas did when he got back.  Because I took that chance, John and I have been together for almost a full year now.

I'm in tears rn because this episode hit little close to home with me. I don't usually talk about stuff like this but I feel like I need to be brave. I am a very social awkward and introverted person, but i am also a pansexual and polyamorous female. i have an amazing partner that I love so much, but before the relationship I was in i was a bad relationship with my ex-girlfriend who was a toxic person.  After that relationship i became scared of talking to people i was crushing on and would often ignore my feelings with probably resulted in losing opportunities at a new relationship all because I was too scared to tell them or even talk to them normally. I wanted to follow my heart but fear just kept taking me over. But I follow became braver until I told someone that I liked them and they liked me back. I don't really know what to say to you, I honestly don't know what I'm doing at the mall today. I don't know what I was looking for. I guess that answers my question. The mall is where you go if you want something, but you don't know what it is, because the mall has everything, right?  er I don't know a lot about anything, least of all myself. and I feel that the hardest when it comes to knowing what I want.  But I know, that I want to take a chance, and talk to you. I have to, because I don't know, when I'm going to know, what I want, again.  And I know, that if I don't act on these feelings right now, I'm going to regret it. I saw you across the food court, and you were so, radiant. I saw you, and I just knew."
